title: Emmanuelex
author: Emmanuelex
content: Please, read before replying, I don't need comments that are off point lol.The last bull run had everyone on the tip of their toes, a lot of people strongly believed that Bitcoin's (BTC) price was going to reach, or possibly cross, the $100,000 price range, which never happened. And there were some who had unbelievable expectations like $500,000 and above, lol (we all know that's not happening anytime soon).Now with the recent events that have taken place, we all can see the bull rising off the dusts, we can almost tell it's about to happen again, maybe by next year or two.¬† I would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it üòäüëç, but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMPlease, read before replying, I don't need comments that are off point lol.You will always have that here; if you want to avoid it, just make your topic self-moderated so that you can wipe out those comments you believe are off-point.Quote I would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it üòäüëç, but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have.  The next bull run, all I can see is about 50,000 and above; I don't see anything above that anytime soon. The market is struggling real hard this time and will need enough anticipation for it to hit more than this in the coming months. Maybe we should expect like 2 bull runs and above before bitcoin can be able to break a new ATH again. That should be possible after the halving, maybe the year after the halving event, which is 2025.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Before you say a comment is off-topic m, you need to know the appropriate board to make your topic, because this thread fits best at speculation.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=57.0So that you won't receive comments that you feel that are off-topic but meanwhile, the topic itself is made on the wrong board.Talking about the next bull run, it seems to me that it is better we remain less speculative in our analysis of the right time and price for Bitcoin to make such a price ATH, but most of us believe that anytime after the next Bitcoin halving, Bitcoin will make a significant price benchmark. Which will be around March-April next year.

comments.author: Catenaccio
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMNow with the recent events that have taken place, we all can see the bull rising off the dusts, we can almost tell it's about to happen again, maybe by next year or two.¬† I would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it üòäüëç, but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have. I see a trend with past halvings and past bull runs, the growth multipliers decrease with latest halvings.If the trend of growth multiplier continues, a new all time high will be.2021 all time high is about x3.45 from 2018 all time high.2024 and 2025 all time high will be highest about 3.45 * $69,000 = $238,000.My prediction is it will be from $70,000 like $100,000 to lower than $200,000

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMPlease, read before replying, I don't need comments that are off point lol.Yeah yeah yeah, as Nwada001 said, you should consider creating self-moderated topics, or creating topics which are simply not based on speculation that attracts sig spammers, don't you think?Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMNow with the recent events that have taken place, we all can see the bull rising off the dusts, we can almost tell it's about to happen again, maybe by next year or two.¬† I would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it üòäüëç, but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have. No one knows anything about it, and no one will ever know anything about the future price of BTC. We're not able to see the future, nor the actuality events which are going to happen, and even if the next halving approaches, no one can guarantee 100% that a bull run will happen again in reality.

comments.author: yudi09
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMPlease, read before replying, I don't need comments that are off point lol.The name of analysis in giving a conditional speculation can be off the mark. For example I would say the time has not yet come assuming there are still more selling than buying. Others will come with different analysis saying the time will come to see a bull market.On the other hand, if someone questions your analysis who believes a price of around $100,000 for the next high is not accepted because it differs from their desired analysis.Discussions will have comments that are off the mark because an idea needs to be debated with complete arguments.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: First, this topic is the best fit in the speculation section of the forum, and if you must know, I strongly believe that Bitcoin will surpass $100,000 within the next 1.6 years or so. It's no more news that the coin reached about $70,000 ATH months after the last halving, I expect the next halving to be more significant. And as the last one reached a market capitalization of over $1 trillion with a price of $70,000 when people have not known the coin and be preparing for it this much, I wonder what it would do after the next halving this time that more people would not want to miss out.I expect a market capitalization of over $2 trillion this time, and by natural/demand calculation, Bitcoin should be at least around $140,000 or more by then (1.6 years).

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMPlease, read before replying, I don't need comments that are off point lol.The last bull run had everyone on the tip of their toes, a lot of people strongly believed that Bitcoin's (BTC) price was going to reach, or possibly cross, the $100,000 price range, which never happened. And there were some who had unbelievable expectations like $500,000 and above, lol (we all know that's not happening anytime soon).You were not on this forum at that time. When bitcoin got to $63500 the second time and increased to $69000 which was in November 2021, people have been thinking that the bull market would turn to bear market on this forum. Not long, the bear market started. We were not predicting all-time-high of $100000, only few thought of that.Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMNow with the recent events that have taken place, we all can see the bull rising off the dusts, we can almost tell it's about to happen again, maybe by next year or two.¬† I would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it , but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have. We are now predicting all-time-high of over $100000 this time. I predict $170000.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMThe last bull run had everyone on the tip of their toes, a lot of people strongly believed that Bitcoin's (BTC) price was going to reach, or possibly cross, the $100,000 price range, which never happened. And there were some who had unbelievable expectations like $500,000 and above, lol (we all know that's not happening anytime soon).Some people believe everything they hear and read, and there are so many so-called experts who were fascinated by the $100 000 and they repeated it like broken records. The same thing happened at the end of 2017, only the numbers in the game were much smaller.Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMNow with the recent events that have taken place, we all can see the bull rising off the dusts, we can almost tell it's about to happen again, maybe by next year or two.¬† Which events are you referring to exactly? The whole story about BTC ETFs obviously didn't stimulate the market too much because most people don't understand the difference between futures and spot ETF anyway, and regardless of the powerful players that are involved this time, there are no guarantees that such an ETF will be approved in the US.The only thing that is certain is the halving, but in that case it should be taken into account that even the last halving brought rather modest results compared to the halvings before that. It is realistic to expect that the price of the last ATH will at least double, but past results do not guarantee that history will repeat itself.

comments.author: pawel7777
comments.body: I don't make predictions myself, but based on the analysis of one guy, that I personally find somewhat trusted, we should be expecting a peak of at least $75k.But then we have much bolder prediction from Fundstrat saying that we could see BTC in a range of $140k-$180k, but that's based on assumption that the BlaCkRock's BTC spot ETF application will be successful. I guess we'll just have to wait and see how will that pan out.My personal, uneducated guess is we won't break the $100k in the next cycle. Hope I'm wrong though.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: I invite you to think about my scenario here. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5453194.msg62485641#msg62485641That's just crude speculation, the wild idea, the next ATH ignores the potential for sentimental news, as the last bullrun in the past happened in the midst of econimic crises. Nowadays there are more and more bitcoin holdings in many institutions, I think it's an advantage to support significant price pumps on the spot market without needing more absorption of crypto marketcap into bitcoin.

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMPlease, read before replying, I don't need comments that are off point lol.The last bull run had everyone on the tip of their toes, a lot of people strongly believed that Bitcoin's (BTC) price was going to reach, or possibly cross, the $100,000 price range, which never happened. And there were some who had unbelievable expectations like $500,000 and above, lol (we all know that's not happening anytime soon).Now with the recent events that have taken place, we all can see the bull rising off the dusts, we can almost tell it's about to happen again, maybe by next year or two.¬† I would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it üòäüëç, but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have. The greatest bull run that bitcoin had was the bull run of 2017, price went from something to everything, the rise was phenomenal. The recent bull run wasn't as great and successful as the 2017's bull run but it was still good because bitcoin's price is very high and we should expect 20 times and 50 times increase again. I'll remain positive and still think that we will see a new all-time high but we won't go from 30K to 1 million, that's for sure. Personally, I think that we will reach 100k-150k-200k range, the maximum we can reach will probably be 300k, the absolute maximum after the next bitcoin halving. For sure, everything depends on the impact and influence that external factors will have on Bitcoin. In 2020, Elon Musk had a big influence, the fact that PayPal supported Bitcoin, had a great influence too, hope something similar will happen, like Amazon or eBay accepting bitcoin payments.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: pawel7777 on July 29, 2023, 11:28:00 AMBut then we have much bolder prediction from Fundstrat saying that we could see BTC in a range of $140k-$180k, but that's based on assumption that the BlaCkRock's BTC spot ETF application will be successful. I guess we'll just have to wait and see how will that pan out.Whenever I hear that name, I remember their most influential prophet who could not predict almost anything (Tom Lee), and after years of failure they have a new expert, but considering the personnel in that company, I do not hope that he will be any better than his predecessors.Quote from: pawel7777 on July 29, 2023, 11:28:00 AMMy personal, uneducated guess is we won't break the $100k in the next cycle. Hope I'm wrong though.Don't be such a pessimist, 90% of the forum will hate you Although such an outcome is also possible, I am of the opinion that the price should exceed $100k and come close to $150k - unless everyone starts selling en masse at $100k.

comments.author: gunhell16
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMPlease, read before replying, I don't need comments that are off point lol.The last bull run had everyone on the tip of their toes, a lot of people strongly believed that Bitcoin's (BTC) price was going to reach, or possibly cross, the $100,000 price range, which never happened. And there were some who had unbelievable expectations like $500,000 and above, lol (we all know that's not happening anytime soon).Now with the recent events that have taken place, we all can see the bull rising off the dusts, we can almost tell it's about to happen again, maybe by next year or two.¬† I would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it üòäüëç, but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have. You know that a prediction is a prediction that is never accurate. Now, it's true that most of those who predicted Bitcoin didn't come true, but how many times did something happen that most people didn't expect, bitcoin reaches a value that was unexpected majproty here in the crypto space?I mean, what you say is 100k$ each may happen and it doesn't, but I'm still sure that it can happen is the thing that we don't expect that will happen, you get it?

comments.author: Nrcewker
comments.body: For bull runs we have seen Bitcoins follow a 4 year cycle pattern. And next year is the 4th year. So yes there is high chance that we will see new ATH price for Bitcoins. I don‚Äôt want to mention an exact number for the ATH price, as this time when Bitcoins will rise, it will stop at very high due to the high demand among people to acquire it. People have already seen the hype in 2020, so this time they won‚Äôt miss the opportunity and will continue buying. So this will lead to more scarcity of Bitcoins in the market, hence the price will go up double speed.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: There was a bull run like last month but it seems to have stalled. What is not looking good is that the stock markets are making highs while bitcoin and crypto markets are stalling. Most likely this is due to the Summer and very low liquidity.I think yesterday the price of bitcoin stalled for like 10 mins and barely 1 BTC traded on Binance. It will be like this for another month at least until Fall starts. Usually TradFI also has low liquidity in the summer months. Best to just go outside and play.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: No one can give a specific answer, but the possibility that the price will rise twice as much as ATH is possible. Therefore, if $69,000 represents the peak of the previous session, then $140,000 is possible, and therefore $100,000 is a possible prediction according to historical data, which was different from the previous time, as the price of 100,000 was a very optimistic model.Keep in mind that the price will be above $70,000, then base your plan on the $70,000 price to be on the safe side.

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: Quote from: pawel7777 on July 29, 2023, 11:28:00 AMI don't make predictions myself, but based on the analysis of one guy, that I personally find somewhat trusted, we should be expecting a peak of at least $75k.75k seems kind of low imo, didn't bitcoin already got to 70k back then? And the pattern of halving is that the price triples in value meaning that there's a possibility that bitcoin will again prove those that doubt the potential for a new ATH and those that are too conservative about their estimate peak. I don't want to be cocky with my own speculation but I believe that bitcoin will be crossing the 6-digit territory when the bullrun starts.Quote from: Nrcewker on July 29, 2023, 01:57:08 PMFor bull runs we have seen Bitcoins follow a 4 year cycle pattern. And next year is the 4th year. So yes there is high chance that we will see new ATH price for Bitcoins. I don‚Äôt want to mention an exact number for the ATH price, as this time when Bitcoins will rise, it will stop at very high due to the high demand among people to acquire it. People have already seen the hype in 2020, so this time they won‚Äôt miss the opportunity and will continue buying. So this will lead to more scarcity of Bitcoins in the market, hence the price will go up double speed.Don't be scared to voice out your opinion, the pattern will happen again, I am sure of that. I myself believe that the exact number would be around 3x the previous ATH. Plus you've mentioned already the circumstance where people are going to make sure that they won't miss out on the opportunity which translates imo to increase in demand for bitcoin and with more demand comes increase in prices.

comments.author: CageMabok
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMNow with the recent events that have taken place, we all can see the bull rising off the dusts, we can almost tell it's about to happen again, maybe by next year or two.¬† Recently there have been no worse events in the crypto space or anything that could affect the price of Bitcoin in the market so the possibility of another bull coming into the market is still very reasonable to expect as the revival of the bulls could be based on good things happening in this year so that it can trigger more people not to be afraid to enter the market again next year.QuoteI would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it üòäüëç, but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have. I will be sure for the price of $ 100,000 if the price of Bitcoin at the end of this year is $ 50,000, but if the price of Bitcoin is still not too far from $ 30,000 at the end of this year, I am a little doubtful for $ 100,000 even though that price is a price that is very much expected by all people during the bullrun condition. But for now I will wait and see how much Bitcoin will cost by the end of this year.

comments.author: Sexylizzy2813
comments.body: Quote from: Emmanuelex on July 29, 2023, 08:41:17 AMPlease, read before replying, I don't need comments that are off point lol.You really need to be a teacher with a huge cane to follow up every comments to ensure that happens big manüòÖQuoteThe last bull run had everyone on the tip of their toes, a lot of I would love to know you all's predictions for the next bull. I'm thinking anywhere around $100,000? May looking at how far the previous bull runs were able to reach, I think that would be a good price to place it üòäüëç, but I'm still open to whatever wild opinions you all may have. I'll continue to say it, all these are just prediction or should I say expectations and when it will happen that it will get to $100k no one would see it coming. At this point in time I see Bitcoin struggling to get to a higher price, to me I don't see it getting to $40k in the next two months as it is. Even the next bull might not be what you're thinking at the moment.
